identified-content.person: Koulish, Dr. Lisa Michelle (Dr. Lisa Michelle Holdhoff)

block.p: Dr. Lisa Michelle Koulish, the daughter of Laura and Steven M. Koulish of Manhattan, was married yesterday to Dr. Matthias Holdhoff, the son of Dr. Ursel Holdhoff and Rainer Holdhoff of Hamburg, Germany. Rabbi Peter Schweitzer officiated at the Glen Island Harbour Club in New Rochelle, N.Y.

The bride, 28, recently completed the second year of a pediatrics residency at Children's National Medical Center in Washington. She graduated from Brown and received her medical degree from the Albert Einstein College of Medicine. Her father is a senior counsel in the Bronx for the New York City Law Department. Her mother is the music teacher at Public School 333, the Museum School, in the Bronx.

Dr. Lisa Michelle Koulish, the daughter of Laura and Steven M. Koulish of Manhattan, was married yesterday to Dr. Matthias Holdhoff, the son of Dr. Ursel Holdhoff and Rainer Holdhoff of Hamburg, Germany. Rabbi Peter Schweitzer officiated at the Glen Island Harbour Club in New Rochelle, N.Y.

Dr. Lisa Michelle Koulish, the daughter of Laura and Steven M. Koulish of Manhattan, was married yesterday to Dr. Matthias Holdhoff, the son of Dr. Ursel Holdhoff and Rainer Holdhoff of Hamburg, Germany. Rabbi Peter Schweitzer officiated at the Glen Island Harbour Club in New Rochelle, N.Y.

The bride, 28, recently completed the second year of a pediatrics residency at Children's National Medical Center in Washington. She graduated from Brown and received her medical degree from the Albert Einstein College of Medicine. Her father is a senior counsel in the Bronx for the New York City Law Department. Her mother is the music teacher at Public School 333, the Museum School, in the Bronx.

The bridegroom, 32, is to begin an oncology fellowship at Johns Hopkins School of Medicine in July. He graduated from the Berlin University of the Arts and received his medical degree from the Free University of Berlin and a doctoral degree in medicine from Charit√©-University Medicine Berlin. His mother is a pediatrician in Hamburg. His father retired as a music and English teacher at Gymnasium Bramfeld, a high school in Hamburg.
